feedingSession.title: Orangutan Feeding Session
feedingSession.subtitle: Semenggoh Wildlife Center
feedingSession.description: Step into the heart of Borneo's lush rainforest and witness the awe-inspiring sight of orangutans in their natural habitat.

natureWalk.title: Nature Trail Walk
natureWalk.subtitle: Semenggoh Nature Reserve
natureWalk.description: Immerse yourself in the beauty of Borneo's rich rainforest with our guided nature trail walk. Discover diverse flora and fauna in their natural habitat.

photoSession.title: Photo Session with Orangutans
photoSession.subtitle: Semenggoh Wildlife Photography Area
photoSession.description: Capture unforgettable moments with the orangutans in their natural habitat. Join our guided photo session to get up close and personal with these amazing creatures.

giftShop.title: Gift Shop
giftShop.subtitle: Semenggoh Wildlife Center Souvenir Store
giftShop.description: Take home a memory of your visit! Explore our wide variety of souvenirs, including locally crafted items, educational toys, and wildlife-themed gifts.
giftShop.items: Locally crafted souvenirs and wildlife-themed gifts

rehabilitation.title: Orangutan Rehabilitation Program
rehabilitation.subtitle: Semenggoh Wildlife Center
rehabilitation.description: The orangutan rehabilitation program aims to rescue, rehabilitate, and eventually release displaced or orphaned orangutans back into their natural habitat. It focuses on providing them with the necessary skills to survive independently in the wild while promoting conservation efforts.

quiz.title: Wildlife Quizziz
quiz.description: Join our quiz now for a chance to win a voucher for 20% off at our souvenir shop!

conservation.title: Wildlife Conservation Program
conservation.subtitle: Semenggoh Wildlife Center
conservation.description: Wildlife conservation is the practice of protecting animal species and their habitats to ensure biodiversity and ecological balance. It aims to prevent extinction, promote sustainable ecosystems, and preserve natural environments for future generations.

map.headerDescription: Welcome to Semenggoh Wildlife Centre, where you can discover the amazing habitat of orangutans and explore the beautiful nature trails. Use the interactive map below to explore key locations within the center, including the Orangutan Feeding Platform, Main Entrance, Vet Clinic, and more.

faq.openingHours: What are the opening hours of Semenggoh Wildlife Centre?
faq.openingHoursAnswer: Semenggoh Wildlife Centre is open daily from 8:00 AM to 10:00 AM and 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM. Please plan your visit accordingly.
faq.bestTimeToSee: What is the best time to see the orangutans?
faq.bestTimeToSeeAnswer: The best time to see the orangutans is during feeding times, which are at 9:00 AM and 3:00 PM. However, sightings are not guaranteed as the orangutans roam freely in the reserve.
faq.ticketsInAdvance: Do I need to buy tickets in advance?
faq.ticketsInAdvanceAnswer: Tickets can be purchased at the entrance of the wildlife centre. There is no need to buy tickets in advance, but it is recommended to arrive early during peak seasons.
faq.parkingAvailable: Is there parking available at the wildlife centre?
faq.parkingAvailableAnswer: Yes, there is parking available at Semenggoh Wildlife Centre for both cars and buses.
faq.bringFoodDrinks: Can I bring food and drinks to the centre?
faq.bringFoodDrinksAnswer: You are allowed to bring food and drinks, but please avoid feeding the animals and ensure all waste is disposed of properly to protect the environment.

voucher.title: Voucher
voucher.instruction: Present this voucher code to the Souvenir Shop staff at checkout to enjoy your discount.

alert.message: Do you want to redeem this voucher?

argus.title: Great Argus Pheasant
argus.description: The Great Argus Pheasant is a large and spectacular bird known for its long tail feathers and intricate wing patterns used in courtship displays. It is one of the most impressive species of the pheasant family.
argus.habitat: This pheasant species inhabits tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, including lowland forests and hilly areas. It prefers dense underbrush and areas with ample cover.
argus.food: Fruits, insects, and small invertebrates found in the forest undergrowth.

orangutan.title: Orangutan
orangutan.description: The orangutan is one of the world's most intelligent primates, known for its reddish-brown hair, high intelligence, and ability to use tools. It primarily lives in the rainforests of Borneo and Sumatra.
orangutan.habitat: Orangutans inhabit tropical rainforests and spend most of their time in trees, where they build nests to sleep in at night.
orangutan.food: Fruits, leaves, bark, insects, and sometimes small mammals.

crocodile.title: Crocodile
crocodile.description: Crocodiles are large, carnivorous reptiles known for their strong jaws, sharp teeth, and amphibious lifestyle. They are apex predators and can be found in rivers, lakes, and swamps.
crocodile.habitat: Crocodiles inhabit freshwater rivers, lakes, wetlands, and occasionally brackish water environments.
crocodile.food: Fish, amphibians, birds, and small to large mammals depending on their size.

porcupine.title: Porcupine
porcupine.description: Porcupines are large rodents with coats of sharp quills that serve as a defense against predators. They are primarily nocturnal and feed on vegetation.
porcupine.habitat: Porcupines are found in forests, deserts, and grasslands, often seeking shelter in trees, rock crevices, and burrows.
porcupine.food: Plant materials, including leaves, fruits, bark, and roots.

pig.title: Bearded Pig
pig.description: The Bearded Pig is a species of wild pig distinguished by its prominent 'beard' of coarse hair. It plays a key role in forest ecosystems by dispersing seeds.
pig.habitat: Bearded pigs are typically found in rainforests, mangroves, and forested swamps, primarily in Southeast Asia.
pig.food: Roots, tubers, fruits, and small animals such as insects.

sambar.title: Sambar Deer
sambar.description: The Sambar Deer is a large deer species native to the Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia. Males have impressive antlers and they are known for their strength and adaptability.
sambar.habitat: Sambar deer inhabit forests, grasslands, and hilly terrains, often near water sources.
sambar.food: Grasses, leaves, fruits, and various shrubs.
